frame.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a structure made of wood, metal, plastic etc that surrounds something such as a picture or window, and holds it in place
frame.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: They removed the picture from its wooden frame.
frame.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: the structure or main supporting parts of a piece of furniture, vehicle, or other object
frame.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: the general shape formed by the bones of someone’s body
frame.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: the metal or plastic part of a pair of glasses that holds the lenses
frame.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: the main ideas, facts etc that something is based on
frame.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: A clear explanation of the subject provides a frame on which a deeper understanding can be built.
Some comments may or may not be understood as harassment, depending on your frame of reference  (=knowledge and beliefs that influence the way you think).
frame.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: an area of film that contains one photograph, or one of the series of separate photographs that make up a film or video
frame.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: a complete part in the games of snooker or bowling
frame.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: I won the next three frames.
frame.translation[0].definitions[7].defi: one of the areas into which a webpage is divided
frame.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to surround something with something else so that it looks attractive or can be seen clearly
frame.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Sarah’s face was framed by her long dark hair.
She stood there, framed against the doorway.
frame.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to put a picture in a structure that will hold it firmly
frame.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: I’m going to get the picture framed.
frame.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to deliberately make someone seem guilty of a crime when they are not guilty, by lying to the police or in a court of law
frame.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: Needham’s lawyers claimed that he had been framed by the police.
The two men were framed for murder.
frame.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: to carefully plan the way you are going to ask a question, make a statement etc
frame.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: She wondered how she was going to frame the question.
frame.translation[1].definitions[4].defi: to organize and develop a plan, system etc
frame.translation[1].definitions[4].exam: Newman played a central role in framing the new law.
